oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1940-03-30 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 30, 1940. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Ford Rush with Ford Rush Jr., Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys, Robert Lunn, and Jack Shook and the Missouri Mountaineers (introduced by David Stone but not mentioned by George D. Hay). Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Bill Monroe; Blue Grass Boys
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: [Unidentified instrumental, test band] (excerpt) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- George D. Hay talks -- Flop-Eared Mule -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- The Rising Sun (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay talks -- Get Along Home Cindy (Roy Acuff) -- George D. Hay introduces Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys -- Muleskinner Blues (Bill Monroe and Blue Grass Boys) -- George D. Hay talks -- Fisher's Hornpipe -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- Closing theme (Ragtime Annie) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay) -- Closing statement (David Stone)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Shook, Jack; Missouri Mountaineers (Musical group); Monroe, Bill, 1911-1996; Blue Grass Boys; Lunn, Robert; Rush, Ford Jr.
